{"id_":"0eed35d0-0311-4c78-872b-9e1c707f73ee","metadata":{"url":"https://api.cloudsort.com/api-docs"},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"551ed63b-9e02-487e-a57d-95f7fd46394e","metadata":{"url":"https://api.cloudsort.com/api-docs"},"hash":"zA1G6gtcDIM9+htSWo2CSQzS4EYHX071Eag1+DF2AJM="},"PREVIOUS":{"nodeId":"dad3ea54-1e07-4652-abf5-06e026ffd647","metadata":{"url":"https://api.cloudsort.com/api-docs"},"hash":"7c02TlnWKGjaYN5KRyYiAMH+pQU4q5UsoFyzHaqWrmQ="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"3aded1a2-689f-4c27-b637-8a322902bb32","metadata":{},"hash":"axVbAOoOUHRJP7zcm7/5hJvUCQAP+xxPfE3ucuPm2rU="}},"text":"It is possible to customize the filenames the system generates, for more information and guidance regarding that, please reach out to your support contact.Non-JSON Format
The system also allows to modify the format in which the WebHooks are sending payloads.The following formats are available:

JSON (default)
CSV

It is important to note, that the CSV format is only provided as a legacy tool, and does not contain the full depth of data as e.g.the JSON format due to limitations of the CSV data layout.Some formats can additionally be customized with specific dialects, e.g.a custom set of CSV header names, to make use of this feature, please reach out to your support contact.WebHooks State & History
The WebHooks system provides additional tools to ease the development and troubleshooting process while integrating, or facing availability issues.Each WebHook subscription can be explicitly disabled via the disabled boolean flag that can be used in the PATCH API endpoint.A disabled subscription will still generate the payloads, and only stop communicating them to the target system.This gives the target system time to recover, or modify the integration, without loosing any events.Once the target system is ready to receive the webhooks, they can be replayed.Each subscription provides a "History" API endpoint, that allows the retrieval and inspection of past executions of the webhook.The history data for a WebHook subscription will expose a task_id that can be used to replay the given event at any time.Replaying WebHooks
WebHook events can be replayed in two ways - both actions are executed via the same Task API Resubmit Endpoint:

Specific list of events
Time-range of events

In order to re-transmit a single, or list of specific WebHook event, collect the task_id values from the History API available on the WebHooks API and use the following payload.Please note that using the all parameter is needed if some or all of the events have been marked as a successful initial transmission.The resubmit API will otherwise ignore already succeeded events and filter the provided list of IDs to only failed/pending events.{
  "all": true,
  "task_ids": [<id1>, <id2>, ...]}

To re-transmit an entire range of tasks, collect the object_id and object_type_id information from the WebHooks API via the task_object_summary property of the details response.Using the following payload will re-transmit an entire time range.Again, using all is encouraged if the actual execution state of the events should be ignored.If not provided, or false, the system will only re-transmit the failed/pending events.{
  "all": true,
  "object_id": <id>,
  "object_type_id": <type id>,
  "from_date": "YYYY-MM-DDTHH-mm-ssZ",
  "to_date": "YYYY-MM-DDTHH-mm-ssZ"
}

WebHook events are not replayed through the main-line queues, but through a secondary system.This secondary system is throttled to prevent overloads on the CloudSort system, as well as on the target system.Please reach out to your support contact for more details on expected delivery times of large volume re-transmissions.Automatically Disabled WebHooks
The system has a protective mechanism in which it will automatically disable faulty WebHook Subscriptions.The decision to disable a subscription is based on the volume of events and a failure rate calculated over a rolling window.If a WebHook gets disabled automatically, the subscriber will be notified via the emails provided in the notification_emails list when setting up the subscription.It is important to note that while a WebHook is disabled, no payloads are lost.The system simply stops communicating with the target.Once the WebHook is re-enabled, the previous unsent payloads can be manually re-transmitted.Please review the "Replaying WebHooks" section or reach out to your support contact for more information.Subscription Examples
To susbcribe to different WebHook events, see belows examples.Tracking Updates: All Resources
The following will create a subscription for all tracking updates for all resources
APIHOST="https://api.cloudsort.com"
TOKEN=...curl -X POST "${APIHOST}/api/webhooks/" \
    -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
    -H 'accept: application/json' \
    -H "Authorization: Bearer $TOKEN" \
    -d '{
           "url": <URL of Receiver Endpoint>,
           "method": <POST|PUT>,
           "filter_events": [
              {
                "filter_type": "TRACKING_UPDATE",
                "resource_type": "*",
                "event_types": []
              }
           ]
        }'

>>> {
  "id": <ID>,
  ...}

Tracking Updates: Containers only
The following will create a subscription for all tracking updates for containers
APIHOST="https://api.cloudsort.com"

Webhook Payloads
The following extract outlines the schema used by the webhook system.The data a subscriber will receive is of type
WebHookEvent.Payload Sizes

TRACKING_UPDATE: tracking update payloads typically range from 1kb - 10kb (larger payloads might be received!).The size depedends on the number of events registered for the given resource.OUTBOUND_MANIFEST: outbound manifest payloads can become relatively large.The expected size is around 1mb per 1000 packages.Clients should ensure that according to their expectations, larger payloads are handled correctly.definitions:

  # The main WebHook Event Structure - this is the container for all WebHook payloads
  # and according to the `type`, the `payload` will vary.WebHookEvent:
    title: Web Hook Event
    type: object
    properties:
      id:
        description: The ID of the webhook event.type: string
        format: uuid4
      timestamp:
        description: The time the web hook event was first sent.type: string
        format: date-time
      type:
        description: The type of webhook event.This will inform the schema of the `payload` property.type: string
        enum:
        - TRACKING_UPDATE
        - OUTBOUND_MANIFEST
      payload:
        description: The list of event payloads, e.g.TrackingUpdatePayload, or OutboundManifestPayload.type: object

  # Payload for `TRACKING_UPDATE` WebHooks
  TrackingUpdatePayload:
    title: Tracking Update Payload
    description: |

      The payload for webhook events of type `TRACKING_UPDATE` will contain
      a reference to the resource that was updated (e.g.a package), and what
      the updated event was.Refer to the `event` property to understand what triggered the webhook event,
      refer to the `event_history` property to see all `events` triggered so far for
      the given package or container.type: object
    properties:
      resource:
        description: The resource type for which the event was registered.type: string
        enum:
        - PACKAGE
        - CONTAINER
      id:
        description: The system internal ID of the resource for which the event was registered.type: integer
      tracking_number:
        description: The tracking number of the resource for which the event was registered.type: string
      tracking_number_alias:
        description: The human readable alias of the tracking number of the resource for which the event was registered.type: string
      original_tracking_number:
        description: The original tracking number of the resource in case it has been relabeled.type: string
      external_tracking_number:
        description: The shipper/customer-specific tracking number of the resource for which the event was registered.type: string
      owner_id:
        description: The customer ID owning the resource.type: integer
      owner_name:
        description: The customer name owning the resource.type: string
      shipper_id:
        description: The shipper ID responsible for the resource upstream of the customer.type: integer
      shipper_name:
        description: The shipper name responsible for the resource upstream of the customer.type: string
      carrier_id:
        description: The carrier ID of the resource.type: integer
      carrier_name:
        description: The carrier name of the resource.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT","hash":"5GFsAdT1cr8+I07I/8p1+Sgp+prsJ0ipHLfs8CNIOps="}

System InformationThe CloudSort System is a cloud-native service hosted by Google Cloud Platform (GCP).Sortation sites are connected via a centralized API that provides instructions to operator devices and administration tools.The API also interfaces with external organizations.Cloud Platform and InfrastructureThe CloudSort System, from data and storage to API, is made available via dedicated resources leveraging Google Cloud Platform (GCP).As such, the system's components are provided in a highly scalable and resilient environment with high availability and low latency.It is replicated across multiple regions of the US territory to improve the operational speed and processing.Persisted data is regularly backed up and archived to ensure zero-loss and the possibility of tracing any customer or processing related issues arising during operations.Furthermore, using GCP enables the system to rely on state-of-the-art security, encryption and access protection for all resources and information entrusted to the components.API LayerThe RESTful API provided by the system forms the core communication interface for any external and internal client.It follows and provides an openAPI V2 compliant format, that is available in the common JSON and YAML formats, as well as on a visual, interactive website hosted by the CloudSort System (access is provided with developer credentials).Any access to the API or any component of the API service is secured with state-of-the-art SSL encryption, in combination with a set of access credentials.Furthermore, the access credentials are used to determine rights and permissions and limit access to resources and operations that the API exposes.Access credentials (ie.user and password) for the API are not used directly, but follow an exchange process to obtain industry standard RFC7519 compliant JSON Web Tokens (JWT).","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT","hash":"aM0lq86qnKCE3QsCpzfgV4pmYANBS7fPjLJCKqeyBO8="}

592ed80a-03d1-48e5-9437-4e7425b622c8.__data__:
{"id_":"592ed80a-03d1-48e5-9437-4e7425b622c8","metadata":{"url":"https://api.cloudsort.com/api-docs"},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"551ed63b-9e02-487e-a57d-95f7fd46394e","metadata":{"url":"https://api.cloudsort.com/api-docs"},"hash":"zA1G6gtcDIM9+htSWo2CSQzS4EYHX071Eag1+DF2AJM="},"PREVIOUS":{"nodeId":"e6a4e9dd-bcde-499c-85bd-a7026689c2ec","metadata":{"url":"https://api.cloudsort.com/api-docs"},"hash":"kBAsRXmg4q/9etc8TwVO9wOdzKWnYK9Jd9dC+tTeoDA="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"38262a7b-e8fe-46fe-849f-fa1d8a9046e3","metadata":{},"hash":"SbhYiP92vj71Jvyls7c9PgXlF9CH9GArMrPE0j2bN4I="}},"text":"Furthermore, using GCP enables the system to rely on state-of-the-art security, encryption and access protection for all resources and information entrusted to the components.API LayerThe RESTful API provided by the system forms the core communication interface for any external and internal client.It follows and provides an openAPI V2 compliant format, that is available in the common JSON and YAML formats, as well as on a visual, interactive website hosted by the CloudSort System (access is provided with developer credentials).Any access to the API or any component of the API service is secured with state-of-the-art SSL encryption, in combination with a set of access credentials.Furthermore, the access credentials are used to determine rights and permissions and limit access to resources and operations that the API exposes.Access credentials (ie.user and password) for the API are not used directly, but follow an exchange process to obtain industry standard RFC7519 compliant JSON Web Tokens (JWT).Therefore to access an API endpoint, a client first goes through an authentication process with a username and password with the JWT endpoint to obtain an access token, and then requests the desired resource providing the token to the API via the HTTP authorization header.The API itself is furthermore split into multiple sections, that are or not available for the given credentials.Depending on the user’s type (e.g.Customer, Carrier, or Internal/Staff) the API may restrict visibility and access to certain groups of resources, but always provides the endpoints necessary for the given use case.Data and Storage LayerThe different kinds of data stored by the system, e.g.files, columnar-data, or image data, are managed by GCP provided services, which enable SSL encrypted communication and at rest encryption using the 256-bit Advanced Encryption Standard (AES-256).Any access facilitated via the APIs, the operator device or the administrator tool requires a valid user to be active in the system.Users are created in a secure, dedicated part of the administrator tool.Within seconds a new operator is onboarded, a badge printed and sent to the shop floor without time consuming overhead.Integrate with CloudSortIntegration with and use of the CloudSort System requires the following resources:

Internet-enabled (Ethernet, WiFi or LTE) PC, Laptop, or portable device with a chromium-based web browser (Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge) to access the administrator tools.Internet-enabled (WiFi) LTE Zebra device (such as TC26 scanner) to be used by the operator.Compatible printer to be coupled with the Zebra devices to print container and package labels on-site.Management of the devices and operator tool is performed via Android Device Management (ADM) facilitating group-wide roll outs, configurations and maintenance of the devices.


Upstream and Downstream IntegrationsTo facilitate integrations with business partners, shippers and carriers, the CloudSort System is built on a pluggable, extensible infrastructure. This allows for the addition of custom modules as needed. Almost any data and communication requirements can be met within a short development cycle. Bi-directional data flow is supported, the system is equipped to either pull or push data from external entities, notify or receive notifications from third parties and aggregate or translate inbound and outbound data.
 
 
 

GlossaryResources and Terms
User: a person or machine, identified by a username, who utilizes the CloudSort system. Use of the Cloudsort APIs, operator tool or administrator tool, requires a valid user in the system.

Container: a virtual representation of the physical aggregation of packages into bags, pallets, Gaylords, etc. Containers result from the sortation process and are designed around destination, carrier or package characteristics. Container detail includes a unique identifier, package count, container weight and cubic volume.

Package: a virtual representation of physical packages with detailed information about customer, destination, shipper, carrier, mail classes, delivery times, weight and sizes.

Outbound Load: a collection of Packages and Containers that will be available at a Dock Door to be delivered on a Route.

Manifest: a mechanism used to transmit information about the physical aspects of the packages being tendered to CloudSort (Inbound Manifests), or being tendered by CloudSort to a downstream organization (Outbound Manifests). Manifests typically include package level detail such as size, weight, destination, classification, etc.

Tracking: a dedicated tracking event stream used to trace and store information about packages, such as location.

Labels: CloudSort provides printable labels for containers and packages. These are published as ZPL-code or image files.

Carrier: a Carrier is a company or a person legally entitled to transport goods. Usually, the Carrier works with Customers and Shippers to ship goods from one place to the other.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT","hash":"SRZtdSe80/qRm6MT7FopNw0jK+ol8xaTed9KqHHeO/8="}

38262a7b-e8fe-46fe-849f-fa1d8a9046e3.__data__:
{"id_":"38262a7b-e8fe-46fe-849f-fa1d8a9046e3","metadata":{"url":"https://api.cloudsort.com/api-docs"},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"551ed63b-9e02-487e-a57d-95f7fd46394e","metadata":{"url":"https://api.cloudsort.com/api-docs"},"hash":"zA1G6gtcDIM9+htSWo2CSQzS4EYHX071Eag1+DF2AJM="},"PREVIOUS":{"nodeId":"592ed80a-03d1-48e5-9437-4e7425b622c8","metadata":{"url":"https://api.cloudsort.com/api-docs"},"hash":"j2NOlRvN6BijOevEsv7Y0jtnBp4rSya9STdBueZx8mY="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"3d33c4ea-30d1-4be5-a8c8-79487c3e7d65","metadata":{},"hash":"3a5zDYXEtdkOTigDfdyEWPID7YAUVE5OSXrXNk/ncyw="}},"text":"EventsThe following events are generated from processing a package through a CloudSort middle mile station and a downstream carrier. The order of events follows the expected lifecycle of a Package (though none of the steps is necessarily required and will depend on the individual CloudSort middle mile station operations).

MANIFESTED_INBOUND: A Customer transmitted an Inbound Manifest for the Package or Container.

ARRIVED: The Package has received an arrival scan at a CloudSort middle mile station.

SCANNED: Package or Container was scanned in CloudSort middle mile station.

PRIMARY: The Package or Container has been moved to Primary.

SECONDARY: The Package or Container has been moved to Secondary.

ZONE: The Package or Container has been processed to a Secondary Zone.

CONTAINERIZED: The Package has been placed inside a Container.

STAGED: The Package or Container is moved to a Staging area.

LOADED: The Package or Container is loaded into an Outbound Load.

DISPATCHED: The Package or Container has departed a CloudSort middle mile station in an Outbound Load.

MANIFESTED_OUTBOUND: The Package or Container has been manifested to the downstream Carrier (if integrated).

CARRIER_ARRIVED_AT_FACILITY: The Package or Container arrived to the a Carrier Station.

CARRIER_IN_TRANSIT: The Package or Container is in transit from a CloudSort middle mile station to a Carrier Station or between Carrier Stations.

CARRIER_OUT_FOR_DELIVERY: The Package is being delivered to the final destination by the Carrier.

CARRIER_DELIVERED: The Package was successfully delievered to the final destination by the Carrier.

CARRIER_DELIVERY_FAILED: The Package failed to be delievered to the final destination by the Carrier.The remaining events generated by the system can be considered auxiliary data to the above events and are used for performance and quality control by the CloudSort middle mile stations.Authentication APIThe following endpoints provide the means to authenticate, refresh and manage anything related to accessing the CloudSort System or APIs.See our Authentication Guide for more details.Obtain JWT and Login This endpoint provides a JWT pair (access and refresh token) for
the provided user data.When logging in with a device_id different
from web, the endpoint initiates a session for the
operator, that is reflected in event and other related data.This endpoint is used to sign-in via badge tokens, which are
available to be generated for each user in the system, permitting a
more operator-friendly sign-in process.Access tokens are valid for 24h and refresh tokens for 72h.It is possible to automatically obtain a new JWT pair via the
refresh endpoint within the
expiration period of the refresh token.Request Body schema: application/jsonemailstring <email>  (Email)  The users email to authenticate with, optional if using the users badge token.passwordrequiredstring (Password)   non-empty  The users password to authenticate with, or the users badge token.device_idstring (Device id)   non-empty  Default:  "web" The device ID to assign to the session, use web for web-based activities, or leave empty.Responses200 400 Invalid input.413 Request payload too large.post/auth/loginhttp://0.0.0.0:8000/api/auth/login Request samples PayloadContent typeapplication/jsonCopy{"email": "user@example.com","password": "string","device_id": "web"} Response samples 200400413Content typeapplication/jsonCopy{"access": "string","refresh": "string"}Logout This endpoint terminates the user's session explicitly, while the
authentication token used for this session continues to be valid,
the operator's session data is closed and it is expected that the
token is no longer used.It is not required to use this endpoint for web-based access to the
system.Only device-based access should use the endpoint to signal
de-authentication in the app and provide the reason for the logout.Authorizations:BearerRequest Body schema: application/jsonreasonstring (Reason)  Default:  "NOT_SPECIFIED" Enum: "NOT_SPECIFIED" "INACTIVITY"  Reason for the logout.Setting this to INACTIVITY truncates the users session to the last known event decontaminating usage statistics in the process.Responses200 400 Invalid input.403 Authentication credentials were invalid, absent or insufficient.413 Request payload too large.post/auth/logouthttp://0.0.0.0:8000/api/auth/logout Request samples PayloadContent typeapplication/jsonCopy{"reason": "NOT_SPECIFIED"} Response samples 200400403413Content typeapplication/jsonCopy{ }Reset Password This endpoint allows users to request a password reset email in
instances where the user's password is lost.If this endpoint is used
and a valid email is provided, the user receives an email
requesting to reset the password via the CloudSort Web Application.The
email contains a link that permits you to overwrite the password.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT","hash":"mgUfyqCz8WWhPKFsXe12iW2ineFFtA933H/3yGf05Jw="}

instances where the user's password is lost.If this endpoint is used
and a valid email is provided, the user receives an email
requesting to reset the password via the CloudSort Web Application.The
email contains a link that permits you to overwrite the password.Note that the link is valid only 24h, afterwards a new email has
to be requested.Request Body schema: application/jsonemailrequiredstring <email>  (Email)   non-empty  The email for which to request the password reset.Responses200 Successful Reset.400 Invalid input.413 Request payload too large.post/auth/password_resethttp://0.0.0.0:8000/api/auth/password_reset Request samples PayloadContent typeapplication/jsonCopy{"email": "user@example.com"} Response samples 200400413Content typeapplication/jsonCopy{ }Refresh JWT and Re-Login Similar to the login endpoint,
this API allows to refresh a users authentication via the
provided refresh token.It is typically used when the users
access token is expired, but should not be prompted to login
again.This endpoint allows to re-authenticate such a user
automatically, without an interaction.Once the refresh token is expired, the user is re-prompted
for their credentials.Each refresh request returns a
new JWT pair, providing a new refresh token with the
expiration date reset.Request Body schema: application/jsonrefreshrequiredstring (Refresh)   non-empty  The refresh JWT obtained from a previous refresh request, or login request.Responses200 400 Invalid input.413 Request payload too large.post/auth/refresh/http://0.0.0.0:8000/api/auth/refresh/ Request samples PayloadContent typeapplication/jsonCopy{"refresh": "string"} Response samples 200400413Content typeapplication/jsonCopy{"access": "string","refresh": "string"}Packages APIThe following endpoints provide the means to view package data, as well as register individual packages as part of a manifesting strategy.Create Package This endpoint allows a User to create a package in the CloudSort system,
registering it and its properties, as well as generating tracking
and vendor related data.Once a package is created, it can be
shipped (and optionally manifested) to a CloudSort Facility using
a custom label or the label data provided by the CloudSort system.The packages are identified by their tracking number while
being processed in CloudSort Facilities.Tracking numbers
must appear on custom labels.To allow richer integration scenarios, it is possible
to send an "external tracking number" alongside the package properties
while creating the package.Authorizations:Bearerquery Parameterssizestring Default:  "4x6" Size (wxh)
dpiinteger Default:  203 DPI
Request Body schema: application/jsonstationinteger (Station)  The Station for which the Package is manifested.ownerinteger (Owner)  The Owner ID of the Package.external_tracking_numberstring (External tracking number)   [ 1 ..250 ] characters  The Package's Shipper Tracking Number issued for the Shipper.shipperinteger or null (Shipper)  The Shipper ID of the Package.shipper_station_namestring (Shipper station name)   [ 1 ..250 ] characters  The Name of the Packages Origin Station.carrierinteger (Carrier)  The Carrier ID of the Package.consignee_addressstring (Consignee address)   <= 150 characters  The address of the package destination.consignee_address_citystring (Consignee address city)   <= 150 characters  The city of the package destination.consignee_address_statestring (Consignee address state)   <= 2 characters  The state of the package destination.consignee_full_namestring (Consignee full name)   <= 150 characters  ('The full name of the recipient at the package destination.',)
zipcodestring or null (Zipcode)   <= 150 characters  The Package's Zip Code code reference
consignee_address_countrystring (Consignee address country)   <= 150 characters  The country of the package destination.origin_addressstring (Origin address)   <= 150 characters  The address of the package's origin.origin_address_citystring (Origin address city)   <= 150 characters  The city of the package's origin.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT","hash":"WTvuVTZddoCrNkK3jusTF7yLnRG5AADjULd8CuSzjFI="}

reasons associated with a Package.When a list of hold
reasons is specified in the hold_for field, the CloudSort
system checks for their existence.If they don't already exist,
the system creates and assigns them to the specified Package.Consequently, the Package can only be sorted after
resolving all the listed hold reasons.Each time a new list of hold reasons is passed to the hold_for
field, the system marks any previously unresolved hold reasons
as resolved.If the hold_for field is left blank or not
included in the request, the system assumes all existing hold
reasons have been addressed and marks them as resolved.In essence, this mechanism ensures that the Package's status
reflects the most recent list of hold reasons provided
via the hold_for field.Authorizations:BearerRequest Body schema: application/jsontext/csvapplication/jsonexternal_idstring or null (External id)   <= 128 characters  An external ID by the manifesting Entity.packagesArray of objects (NestedInboundManifestPackage)  The packages declared on the Manifest.containersArray of objects (NestedInboundManifestContainer)  The containers declared on the Manifest.The tracking_number field can be used to link items of the packages list via the container_tracking_number.loadsArray of objects (NestedInboundManifestLoad)  The load declared on the Manifest.The name field can be used to link items of the packages and containers list via the load_name field.Responses201 Inbound manifest received and accepted.400 Invalid input.403 Authentication credentials were invalid, absent or insufficient.413 Request payload too large.post/manifests/inbound/http://0.0.0.0:8000/api/manifests/inbound/ Request samples PayloadContent {"id_":"76fe8b8b-8504-4e3d-80fb-be21eef1e5b2","metadata":{"url":"https://api.cloudsort.com/api-docs"},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"551ed63b-9e02-487e-a57d-95f7fd46394e","metadata":{"url":"https://api.cloudsort.com/api-docs"},"hash":"zA1G6gtcDIM9+htSWo2CSQzS4EYHX071Eag1+DF2AJM="},"PREVIOUS":{"nodeId":"518ba174-e220-43c6-97f4-14ae6985c7f7","metadata":{"url":"https://api.cloudsort.com/api-docs"},"hash":"1Z42lnuc2BIHtiwSKXASCeiH5h5JzzP/QhBnKTXpeZo="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"58f4060b-3024-45c9-b548-4ae655855217","metadata":{},"hash":"sNe3AEpEUFLEeyC3KonvOZkw8740JP6pA8rMB1KkZm4="}},"text":"404 Object does not exist or caller has insufficient permissions to access it.get/manifests/{id}/http://0.0.0.0:8000/api/manifests/{id}/ Response samples 200403404Content typeapplication/jsonCopy Expand all  Collapse all {"id": 0,"external_id": "string","outbound": true,"inbound": true,"station": 0,"owner": 0,"owner_full_name": "","fmc": 0,"fmc_full_name": "","containers": [0],"packages": [0],"total_containers": 0,"total_containerized_packages": 0,"total_packages": 0,"total_volume": 0,"total_loads": 0,"predicted_arrival_packages": 0,"total_predicted_and_arrived_packages": 0,"total_predicted_and_arrived_volume": 0,"total_arrived_packages": 0,"total_arrived_volume": 0,"predicted_arrival_volume": 0,"created_on": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z","modified_on": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z","transmitted_on": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z","received_on": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z","finalized_on": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z","details": {"version": 0,"external_id": "string","raw_data": "string","raw_response_data": "string","errors": [{"message": "string"}],"warnings": [{"message": "string"}]},"status": "NEW"}Webhooks APIThe Webhooks API is used to manage subscriptions to the CloudSort Webhook System.Get Outbound WebHook Subscriptions This endpoint returns a list of WebHook Subscriptions.In order to make the
request, the user needs to be either:

Super User/Corporate Admin, in which the User will have access to all
WebHook Subscriptions;
Customer or Organization Staff in which the User will only have access
to the WebHook Subscriptions assigned and created by them.Authorizations:Bearerquery Parametersownerinteger Filter by Owner ID
organizationinteger Filter by Organization ID
pageinteger A page number within the paginated result set, starting with 1.If larger than the available number of pages the endpoint returns a 404.Defaults to 1.page_sizeinteger The number of results to load per page.This determines the total number of available pages.Set this to 0 to get only the count as a response.Defaults to 10.Responses200 403 Authentication credentials were invalid, absent or insufficient.get/webhooks/http://0.0.0.0:8000/api/webhooks/ Response samples 200403Content typeapplication/jsonCopy Expand all  Collapse all {"count": 0,"next": "http://example.com","previous": "http://example.com","results": [{"id": 0,"disabled": true,"name": "string","notification_emails": ["string"],"url": "string","method": "POST","format": "JSON","format_dialect": "string","owner_id": 0,"owner_name": "string","organization_id": 0,"organization_name": "string","filter_events": [{"filter_type": "*","resource_type": "*","station_id": 0,"event_types": [ ]}],"task_object_summary": {"object_id": 0,"object_type_id": "string","created_on": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z","modified_on": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z","last_completed": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z","total_tasks": 0,"total_pending": 0,"total_started": 0,"total_success": 0,"total_failed": 0,"health_reset_on": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z","health_modified_on": "2019-08-24T14:15:22Z","health_count": 0,"health_failure_rate": 0,"health_epm": 0}}]}Create Outbound WebHook Subscription This endpoint creates a new WebHook Subscription.In order to make the
request, the user needs to be:

Customer or Organization Staff in which the User will only have access to
the WebHook Subscriptions assigned and created by them.The request will return the following data:

The id of the WebHook Subscription
The url to which the CloudSort System will notify if a certain event
got triggered.Supported protocols are HTTP, HTTPS, FTP and SFTP.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"

58f4060b-3024-45c9-b548-4ae655855217.__data__:
{"id_":"58f4060b-3024-45c9-b548-4ae655855217","metadata":{"url":"https://api.cloudsort.com/api-docs"},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"551ed63b-9e02-487e-a57d-95f7fd46394e","metadata":{"url":"https://api.cloudsort.com/api-docs"},"hash":"zA1G6gtcDIM9+htSWo2CSQzS4EYHX071Eag1+DF2AJM="},"PREVIOUS":{"nodeId":"76fe8b8b-8504-4e3d-80fb-be21eef1e5b2","metadata":{"url":"https://api.cloudsort.com/api-docs"},"hash":"/ktpq8dIGe1nbsQZR7sBYYGNl6QDyztt0x5hSFSNc2M="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"7e0a60be-c70b-4338-a9d3-a43f6a6e5be7","metadata":{},"hash":"7eoiksZ9zjkMQbDVQYaS+a51UksGH423ausu2O5k3Eg="}},"text":"In order to make the
request, the user needs to be:

Customer or Organization Staff in which the User will only have access to
the WebHook Subscriptions assigned and created by them.The request will return the following data:

The id of the WebHook Subscription
The url to which the CloudSort System will notify if a certain event
got triggered.Supported protocols are HTTP, HTTPS, FTP and SFTP.The method that the CloudSort System will use to do that request -
PUT or POST (only applies if protocol is HTTP or HTTPS)
The owner_id if the WebHook Subscription was created by a Customer
The organization_id if the WebHook Subscription was created by an
Organization Staff
The filter_events which indicates what should trigger the CloudSort
System to notify the Subscriber

The filter_events works as an array of objects that can have the
following fields:

filter_type, e.g.TRACKING_UPDATE or OUTBOUND_MANIFEST.To receive
all webhooks for all types of events, use *.resource_type which defines which resource the Subscriber wants to be
notified of.Can be either PACKAGE or CONTAINER and if empty will
default to PACKAGE.To subscribe to all resource types, use *.station_id which indicates the Station from where the Subscriber wants
to be notified.To subscribe to all stations, leave empty, or omit.Depending on the filter_type the following additional filters are
as well available:

event_types - for TRACKING_UPDATE subscriptions - which defines what
Event types should make the CloudSort System notify the Subscriber about.Use [] (empty list) to subscribe to all possible events, and omit the
parameter to subscribe to the default, most relevant set of events.The disabled flag (also available on the PATCH endpoint) adds the ability
to pause/resume a Subscription temporarily.The system itself may act auto-
matically and disable a Subscription if it detects the target has become
unhealthy.Authorizations:BearerRequest Body schema: application/jsondisabledboolean (Disabled)  If true, the subscription is to be considered deactivated and should not result in requests being made to the target, BUT the system should still generate payloads for the given subscription.namestring (Name)   non-empty  A human readable short description/name of the subscription to make identification of various subscriptions easier.notification_emailsArray of strings[ items  non-empty  ] The emails to notify if the subscription gets automatically disabled due to health issues.urlrequiredstring (Url)   non-empty  The target URL of the subscription.Use either http(s):// or (s)ftp:// protocols.methodstring (Method)  Default:  "POST" Enum: "POST" "PUT"  The method to use to send WebHooks to the target URL (only applicable if URL is of protocol http(s)://).formatstring (Format)  Default:  "JSON" Enum: "JSON" "CSV"  Preview Feature: the format can be used to switch between consuming JSON or CSV.It is important to note that the CSV format comes with significantly reduced details.To get the full details for the WebHook Events, please use JSON format.format_dialectstring (Format dialect)   non-empty  Preview Feature: the dialect can be used to apply a custom header naming convention to a CSV format subscription.Please contact customer support to define the dialect.owner_idinteger (Owner id)  organization_idinteger (Organization id)  filter_eventsrequiredArray of objects (WebHookSubscriptionFilter)  task_object_summaryobject (TaskObjectSummary)  The summary data over the Task history of the object.This contains general, lifetime statistics, as well as health data.The Task API can be used to resubmit tasks for the given object, by
        referencing the object_id and object_type_id.Responses201 400 Invalid input.403 Authentication credentials were invalid, absent or insufficient.413 Request payload too large.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"
","type":"TEXT","hash":"P31S78NjKGG8Ajda26h/CpBBpvc70rYEr8QNz+Zvh2A="}

This API allows to resubmit a given set of tasks via various options.Each group of fields can be used distinctly, only one group of fields
can be used at a time.Use the dry_run query parameter to simulate what would happen and
retrieve a Resubmission Response before actually submitting the list
of tasks.Use the all field to re-submit all tasks, independent of their
execution state.If all is not true, then the resubmission will
only target tasks that have either failed, or not been executed at all.Group 1 - Resubmission via Time-boundary and Object Reference
The fields labeled Group 1 are all required to be set when attempting
to resubmit a list of tasks based on a time range.The object ID and
object type ID references will be provided by the respective resource
API (e.g.WebHooks API).Group 2 - Resubmission via Task IDs
The fields labeled Group 2 are all required to be set when attempting
to resubmit a list of tasks based on their IDs.","textTemplate":"","metadataSeparator":"

retrieve a Resubmission Response before actually submitting the list
of tasks.Use the all field to re-submit all tasks, independent of their
execution state.If all is not true, then the resubmission will
only target tasks that have either failed, or not been executed at all.Group 1 - Resubmission via Time-boundary and Object Reference
The fields labeled Group 1 are all required to be set when attempting
to resubmit a list of tasks based on a time range.The object ID and
object type ID references will be provided by the respective resource
API (e.g.WebHooks API).Group 2 - Resubmission via Task IDs
The fields labeled Group 2 are all required to be set when attempting
to resubmit a list of tasks based on their IDs.Authorizations:Bearerquery Parametersdry_runboolean Simulate the resubmission
